Events.html: 202 BC – Second Punic War: At the Battle of Zama, Roman legions under Scipio Africanus defeat Hannibal Barca, leader of the army defending Carthage.
Events.text: Second Punic War: At the Battle of Zama, Roman legions under Scipio Africanus defeat Hannibal Barca, leader of the army defending Carthage.

Events.html: 439 – The Vandals, led by King Gaiseric, take Carthage in North Africa.
Events.text: The Vandals, led by King Gaiseric, take Carthage in North Africa.

Events.html: 1216 – King John of England dies at Newark-on-Trent and is succeeded by his nine-year-old son Henry.
Events.text: King John of England dies at Newark-on-Trent and is succeeded by his nine-year-old son Henry.

Events.html: 1386 – The Universität Heidelberg held its first lecture, making it the oldest German university.
Events.text: The Universität Heidelberg held its first lecture, making it the oldest German university.

Events.html: 1466 – The Thirteen Years' War ends with the Second Treaty of Thorn.
Events.text: The Thirteen Years' War ends with the Second Treaty of Thorn.

Events.html: 1469 – Ferdinand II of Aragon marries Isabella I of Castile, a marriage that paves the way to the unification of Aragon and Castile into a single country, Spain.
Events.text: Ferdinand II of Aragon marries Isabella I of Castile, a marriage that paves the way to the unification of Aragon and Castile into a single country, Spain.

Events.html: 1512 – Martin Luther becomes a doctor of theology (Doctor in Biblia).
Events.text: Martin Luther becomes a doctor of theology (Doctor in Biblia).

Events.html: 1649 – New Ross town, Co. Wexford, Ireland, surrenders to Oliver Cromwell.
Events.text: New Ross town, Co. Wexford, Ireland, surrenders to Oliver Cromwell.

Events.html: 1781 – At Yorktown, Virginia, representatives of British commander Lord Cornwallis handed over Cornwallis' sword and formally surrendered to George Washington and the comte de Rochambeau.
Events.text: At Yorktown, Virginia, representatives of British commander Lord Cornwallis handed over Cornwallis' sword and formally surrendered to George Washington and the comte de Rochambeau.

links.subject: comte de Rochambeau
links.title: Jean-Baptiste Donatien de Vimeur, comte de Rochambeau

Events.html: 1789 – Chief Justice John Jay is sworn in as the first Chief Justice of the United States.
Events.text: Chief Justice John Jay is sworn in as the first Chief Justice of the United States.

links.subject: Chief Justice of the United States
links.title: Chief Justice of the United States

Events.html: 1805 – Napoleonic Wars: Austrian General Mack surrenders his army to the Grand Army of Napoleon at the Battle of Ulm. 30,000 prisoners are captured and 10,000 casualties inflicted on the losers.
Events.text: Napoleonic Wars: Austrian General Mack surrenders his army to the Grand Army of Napoleon at the Battle of Ulm. 30,000 prisoners are captured and 10,000 casualties inflicted on the losers.

Events.html: 1812 – Napoleon I of France retreats from Moscow.
Events.text: Napoleon I of France retreats from Moscow.

Events.html: 1813 – The Battle of Leipzig concludes, giving Napoleon Bonaparte one of his worst defeats.
Events.text: The Battle of Leipzig concludes, giving Napoleon Bonaparte one of his worst defeats.

Events.html: 1822 – In Parnaíba; Simplício Dias da Silva, João Cândido de Deus e Silva and Domingos Dias declare the independent state of Piauí.
Events.text: In Parnaíba; Simplício Dias da Silva, João Cândido de Deus e Silva and Domingos Dias declare the independent state of Piauí.

Events.html: 1864 – Battle of Cedar Creek – Union Army under Philip Sheridan destroys a Confederate Army under Jubal Early.
Events.text: Battle of Cedar Creek – Union Army under Philip Sheridan destroys a Confederate Army under Jubal Early.

Events.html: 1864 – St. Albans Raid – Confederate raiders launch an attack on Saint Albans, Vermont from Canada.
Events.text: St. Albans Raid – Confederate raiders launch an attack on Saint Albans, Vermont from Canada.

Events.html: 1866 – Venice - Annexion of Veneto and Mantua to Italy - At Hotel Europa, Austria hands over Veneto to France, which hands it immediately over to Italy.
Events.text: Venice - Annexion of Veneto and Mantua to Italy - At Hotel Europa, Austria hands over Veneto to France, which hands it immediately over to Italy.

Events.html: 1900 – Max Planck, in his house at Grunewald, on the outskirts of Berlin, discovers the law of black body emission (Planck's law).
Events.text: Max Planck, in his house at Grunewald, on the outskirts of Berlin, discovers the law of black body emission (Planck's law).

Events.html: 1904 – Polytechnic University of the Philippines founded as Manila Business School through the superintendence of the American C.A. O'Reilley.
Events.text: Polytechnic University of the Philippines founded as Manila Business School through the superintendence of the American C.A. O'Reilley.

Events.html: 1912 – Italy takes possession of Tripoli, Libya from the Ottoman Empire.
Events.text: Italy takes possession of Tripoli, Libya from the Ottoman Empire.

Events.html: 1914 – The First Battle of Ypres begins.
Events.text: The First Battle of Ypres begins.

Events.html: 1917 – The Love Field in Dallas, Texas is opened.
Events.text: The Love Field in Dallas, Texas is opened.

Events.html: 1921 – Portuguese Prime Minister António Granjo and other politicians are murdered in a Lisbon coup.
Events.text: Portuguese Prime Minister António Granjo and other politicians are murdered in a Lisbon coup.

Events.html: 1922 – British Conservative MPs meeting at the Carlton Club vote to break off the Coalition Government with David Lloyd George of the Liberal Party.
Events.text: British Conservative MPs meeting at the Carlton Club vote to break off the Coalition Government with David Lloyd George of the Liberal Party.

Events.html: 1933 – Germany withdraws from the League of Nations.
Events.text: Germany withdraws from the League of Nations.

Events.html: 1935 – The League of Nations places economic sanctions on fascist Italy for its invasion of Ethiopia.
Events.text: The League of Nations places economic sanctions on fascist Italy for its invasion of Ethiopia.

Events.html: 1943 – Streptomycin, the first antibiotic remedy for tuberculosis, is isolated by researchers at Rutgers University.
Events.text: Streptomycin, the first antibiotic remedy for tuberculosis, is isolated by researchers at Rutgers University.

Events.html: 1944 – United States forces land in the Philippines.
Events.text: United States forces land in the Philippines.

Events.html: 1950 – The People's Liberation Army takes control of the town of Qamdo; this is sometimes called the "Invasion of Tibet".
Events.text: The People's Liberation Army takes control of the town of Qamdo; this is sometimes called the "Invasion of Tibet".

Events.html: 1950 – The People's Republic of China joins the Korean War by sending thousands of troops across the Yalu river to fight United Nations forces.
Events.text: The People's Republic of China joins the Korean War by sending thousands of troops across the Yalu river to fight United Nations forces.

Events.html: 1950 – Iran becomes the first country to accept technical assistance from the United States under the Point Four Program.
Events.text: Iran becomes the first country to accept technical assistance from the United States under the Point Four Program.

Events.html: 1954 – First ascent of Cho Oyu.
Events.text: First ascent of Cho Oyu.

Events.html: 1956 – The Soviet Union and Japan sign a Joint Declaration, officially ending the state of war between the two countries that had existed since August 1945.
Events.text: The Soviet Union and Japan sign a Joint Declaration, officially ending the state of war between the two countries that had existed since August 1945.

Events.html: 1969 – The first Prime Minister of Tunisia in twelve years, Bahi Ladgham, is appointed by President Habib Bourguiba.
Events.text: The first Prime Minister of Tunisia in twelve years, Bahi Ladgham, is appointed by President Habib Bourguiba.

Events.html: 1973 – President Richard Nixon rejects an Appeals Court decision that he turn over the Watergate tapes.
Events.text: President Richard Nixon rejects an Appeals Court decision that he turn over the Watergate tapes.

Events.html: 1974 – Niue becomes a self-governing colony of New Zealand.
Events.text: Niue becomes a self-governing colony of New Zealand.

Events.html: 1976 – Battle of Aishiya in Lebanon.
Events.text: Battle of Aishiya in Lebanon.

Events.html: 1986 – Samora Machel, President of Mozambique and a prominent leader of FRELIMO, and 33 others die when their Tupolev 134 plane crashes into the Lebombo Mountains.
Events.text: Samora Machel, President of Mozambique and a prominent leader of FRELIMO, and 33 others die when their Tupolev 134 plane crashes into the Lebombo Mountains.

Events.html: 1986 – The Boston Red Sox win Game 2 of the 1986 World Series versus the New York Mets 9-3 at Shea Stadium.
Events.text: The Boston Red Sox win Game 2 of the 1986 World Series versus the New York Mets 9-3 at Shea Stadium.

Events.html: 1987 – The United States Navy conducts Operation Nimble Archer, an attack on two Iranian oil platforms in the Persian Gulf.
Events.text: The United States Navy conducts Operation Nimble Archer, an attack on two Iranian oil platforms in the Persian Gulf.

Events.html: 1987 – Black Monday - the Dow Jones Industrial Average falls by 22%, 508 points.
Events.text: Black Monday - the Dow Jones Industrial Average falls by 22%, 508 points.

Events.html: 1988 – The British government imposes a broadcasting ban on television and radio interviews with members of Sinn Féin and eleven Irish republican and Ulster loyalist paramilitary groups.
Events.text: The British government imposes a broadcasting ban on television and radio interviews with members of Sinn Féin and eleven Irish republican and Ulster loyalist paramilitary groups.

Events.html: 1989 – The convictions of the Guildford Four are quashed by the Court of Appeal of England and Wales, after they had spent 15 years in prison.
Events.text: The convictions of the Guildford Four are quashed by the Court of Appeal of England and Wales, after they had spent 15 years in prison.

links.subject: Court of Appeal of England and Wales
links.title: Court of Appeal of England and Wales

Events.html: 2001 – SIEV-X, an Indonesian fishing boat en route to Christmas Island, carrying over 400 asylum seekers, sinks in international waters with the loss of 353 people.
Events.text: SIEV-X, an Indonesian fishing boat en route to Christmas Island, carrying over 400 asylum seekers, sinks in international waters with the loss of 353 people.

Events.html: 2003 – Mother Teresa is beatified by Pope John Paul II.
Events.text: Mother Teresa is beatified by Pope John Paul II.

Events.html: 2004 – Care International aid worker Margaret Hassan is kidnapped in Iraq.
Events.text: Care International aid worker Margaret Hassan is kidnapped in Iraq.

Events.html: 2005 – Saddam Hussein goes on trial in Baghdad for crimes against humanity.
Events.text: Saddam Hussein goes on trial in Baghdad for crimes against humanity.

Events.html: 2005 – Hurricane Wilma becomes the most intense Atlantic hurricane on record with a minimum pressure of 882 mb.
Events.text: Hurricane Wilma becomes the most intense Atlantic hurricane on record with a minimum pressure of 882 mb.

Events.html: 2007 – Philippines: A bomb explosion rocked Glorietta 2, a shopping mall in Makati. The blast killed 11 and injured more than 100 people.
Events.text: Philippines: A bomb explosion rocked Glorietta 2, a shopping mall in Makati. The blast killed 11 and injured more than 100 people.

Events.html: 2012 – Big Tex, a 52-foot statue and cultural icon in Dallas, Texas, is destroyed by fire during the final weekend of the 2012 State Fair of Texas.
Events.text: Big Tex, a 52-foot statue and cultural icon in Dallas, Texas, is destroyed by fire during the final weekend of the 2012 State Fair of Texas.

Events.html: 2013 – At least 105 people have been injured in a train crash at the Once railway station in Buenos Aires.
Events.text: At least 105 people have been injured in a train crash at the Once railway station in Buenos Aires.
